intro: Echinocactus simpsonii, commonly known as the Simpson's hedgehog cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical shape and dense covering of spines, which provide protection from herbivores and reduce water loss. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a striking visual element to its appearance. It is well adapted to hot, dry environments and requires minimal water once established. Its slow growth rate makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
